dialogue_turns.speaker: Host
dialogue_turns.text: The Vietnamese group Sovico is pulling out of that airport management deal in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Vietnamese group Sovico is pulling out of that airport management deal in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vietnamese company Sovico Group is no longer considering taking over management of a Kazakh airport, according to Deputy Prime minister " Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the one with Kyzylorda airport? That was the specific region they were eyeing, wasn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the one with Kyzylorda airport? That was the specific region they were eyeing, wasn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He mentioned that the facility in question could be located in the Kyzylorda region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Deputy Prime Minister Zhumangarin just announced they've suspended those plans for now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Deputy Prime Minister Zhumangarin just announced they've suspended those plans for now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, he has currently suspended these plans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because, uh, he'd been talking them up just a few months ago—mentioning they might manage an airport to boost service quality, not necessarily buy it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because, uh, he'd been talking them up just a few months ago-mentioning they might manage an airport to boost service quality, not necessarily buy it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Later, Deputy Foreign Minister Alibek Bakayev clarified that it wasn't a purchase, but rather that the Vietnamese investor might temporarily manage an airport to improve service quality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he also said Sovico's airline, Vietjet Qazaqstan, is still expanding—buying new planes, some for Kazakh routes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he also said Sovico's airline, Vietjet Qazaqstan, is still expanding-buying new planes, some for Kazakh routes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are buying a large number of aircraft, some of which are destined for Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So they still might need a base airport eventually, right? Like, he hinted Turkestan airport was another option they considered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they still might need a base airport eventually, right? Like, he hinted Turkestan airport was another option they considered.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Naturally, they will need a base airport. I've spoken with him frequently"he previously considered the Aktobe airport but was more interested in the Turkestan airport, since, as far as I know, the Turkish partners' management term for that facility has ended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But right now, their focus is totally on the airline itself. The airport plans are on pause.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But right now, their focus is totally on the airline itself. The airport plans are on pause.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the investor is currently focused on developing the airline, the next step may be either acquiring or managing an airport. However, he has currently suspended these plans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It makes sense—you don't wanna stretch too thin when you're, like, building up a new airline operation in a different country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It makes sense-you don't wanna stretch too thin when you're, like, building up a new airline operation in a different country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And with the Turkish partners' management term ending at Turkestan, the opportunity was there, but timing just isn't right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And with the Turkish partners' management term ending at Turkestan, the opportunity was there, but timing just isn't right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I've spoken with him frequently"he previously considered the Aktobe airport but was more interested in the Turkestan airport, since, as far as I know, the Turkish partners' management term for that facility has ended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So no sale, no management deal—at least for the foreseeable future.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So no sale, no management deal-at least for the foreseeable future.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vietnamese company Sovico Group is no longer considering taking over management of a Kazakh airport, according to Deputy Prime minister " Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin. He did not specify when a potential deal might take place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Seems that way. Zhumangarin didn't give any timeline for when things might pick back up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems that way. Zhumangarin didn't give any timeline for when things might pick back up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He did not specify when a potential deal might take place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's a space to watch. Vietjet's involvement shows Kazakhstan's aviation market is attracting foreign interest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, it's a space to watch. Vietjet's involvement shows Kazakhstan's aviation market is attracting foreign interest.
